td.p: RSS feed for Jeffrey Zeldman Presents: The Daily Report

In this week's issue of A List Apart, for people who make websites: FAUX COLUMNS by Dan Cederholm. (Multi-column layouts can run into trouble in CSS. Here's a simple solution.) ELASTIC DESIGN by Patrick Griffiths. (Not quite liquid design, yet not fixed-width either, Elastic Design combines the strengths of both.)

p.a: Wish we'd designed that: Redlabor of love

td.p: Sometimes it all comes together. (Plus: Papa's got a brand new Airbag; Cloninger on archiving, ephemera, and analog distortion; more.)
Lovely, inspiring sites added to our reorganized Externals department.
New free service converts your handwriting to TrueType fonts.
Over 30,000 organized links, with an emphasis on web standards and accessibility.
Free comics in a switchable high/low-bandwidth layout using Stuart Robertson's CSS image map technique (ALA issue 166).
Indie sites, fashion sites, blogger awards, book review, affordable stock photos, more.
Favelets and Linky-poos from us to you.
Resonant chunks of pop culture, plus vaults, dailys, a panorama, and Sir Tim to you.
Redesign: done. Design goals explained. Last browser bugs squashed.

Blogstakes presents your chance to win The Onion Platinum Prestige Encore Gold Premium Collector's edition. It's as easy as typing a link. Previous Blogstakes included a free year of Browsercam and the fabulous Clip-n-Seal.

p.a: The semantic web begins at home

td.p: The site for the First European Semantic Web Symposium is one of the least semantic websites ever produced.
